section.title: Asymptotic Approximations for q-Hahn and Askey–Wilson Classes

para.sentence: Ismail (1986) gives asymptotic expansions as n\to\infty , with x and other parameters fixed, for continuous q -ultraspherical, big and little q -Jacobi, and Askey–Wilson polynomials.
These asymptotic expansions are in fact convergent expansions.

For Askey–Wilson p_{n}\left(\cos\theta;a,b,c,d\,|\,q\right) the leading term is given by \left(bc,bd,cd;q\right)_{n}\*\left(Q_{n}(e^{\mathrm{i}\theta};a,b,c,d\mid q)+Q _{n}(e^{-\mathrm{i}\theta};a,b,c,d\mid q)\right), where with z=e^{\pm\mathrm{i}\theta} , Q_{n}(z;a,b,c,d\mid q)\sim\frac{z^{n}\left(az^{-1},bz^{-1},cz^{-1},dz^{-1};q \right)_{\infty}}{\left(z^{-2},bc,bd,cd;q\right)_{\infty}}, if n\to\infty; z,a,b,c,d,q fixed.
For a uniform asymptotic expansion of the Stieltjes–Wigert polynomials, seeWang and Wong (2006).
For asymptotic approximations to the largest zeros of the q -Laguerre and continuous q^{-1} -Hermite polynomials see Chen and Ismail (1998).
